oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cardio-respiratory Function, School Age Abilities and Quality of Life in Extremely Low Birth Weight Infants
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MacLean, Joanna
Hendson, Leonora
Adatia, Ian
Majaesic, Carina
Lovering, Andrew
Thompson, Richard
Nicholas, David
Thebaud, Bernard
Stickland, Michael
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study examined cardio-respiratory function, school age abilities and quality of life in a large cohort of children 8 to 12 years of age born extremely preterm (EP).

oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Child Sleep Habits Questionnaire (CSHQ); Child Health Questionnaire (CHQ) - Parent Report; Child Behaviour Check List (CBCL); Parent Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Child Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Adolescent Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL); Asthma Pediatric Quality of Life Survey (PedsQL)
